intro: Mairetis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the genus Phormium and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and striking violet or red flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has cultural significance among Māori people. Mairetis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and garden environments. Its fibrous leaves have historically been used for weaving and crafting traditional items.
